content.title: CURRENT STATUS, TRENDS AND BARRIERS TO ENERGY ACCESS

content.intro: M2: Energy Access and Inclusive Energy Services | Chapter 2

content.text: From urban-rural divides to challenges within informal settlements, isolated communities, and fragile contexts, millions worldwide struggle to secure essential energy services. These persistent disparities in global energy access create significant obstacles to sustainable development. This chapter examines the primary drivers of regional and contextual inequalities, providing a data-driven analysis of current energy access trends and exploring the major barriers to universal access. By delving into the status and trends in electricity, clean cooking, and heating and cooling—and addressing the specific needs of underserved populations—this chapter equips you with the insights needed to tackle one of today’s most pressing development challenges.

content.title: Learning Objectives
content.intro: If you only have space to remember 3 things:

objectives.title: The Energy Access Landscape
objectives.description: Understand disparities in energy access across urban, rural, and challenging contexts such as informal settlements, last-mile regions, and fragile areas. Explore the defining features of the “Global Energy Gap” and the unique challenges within each layer.

objectives.title: Status and Trends
objectives.description: Examine current data on energy access for electricity, clean cooking, and heating and cooling. Gain insight into global progress, emerging trends, and specific gaps toward achieving universal, sustainable energy access.

objectives.title: Challenges for Universal Energy Access
objectives.description: Identify core challenges to expanding sustainable energy for vulnerable populations and underserved regions. Explore approaches to bridge divides and achieve equitable access for all.
